org.apache.james.mailbox.model

Interface MailboxACL.MailboxACLRights

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Iterable<MailboxACL.MailboxACLRight>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    SimpleMailboxACL.Rfc4314Rights
    Enclosing interface:
    MailboxACL

    public static interface MailboxACL.MailboxACLRights
extends Iterable<MailboxACL.MailboxACLRight>
    Iterable set of MailboxACL.MailboxACLRights. Implementations may decide to support only a specific range of rights, e.g. the Standard Rights of RFC 4314 section 2.1. Implementations must not allow adding or removing of elements once this MailboxACLRights are initialized.

      Performs the set theoretic operation of union of this MailboxACLRights and toAdd MailboxACLRights.

    • Method Detail

      • contains

        boolean contains(MailboxACL.MailboxACLRight right)
                 throws UnsupportedRightException
        Tells whether this contains the given right.
        Parameters:
        right -
        Returns:
        Throws:
        UnsupportedRightException - iff the given right is not supported.

      • except

        MailboxACL.MailboxACLRights except(MailboxACL.MailboxACLRights toRemove)
                                   throws UnsupportedRightException
        Performs the set theoretic operation of relative complement of toRemove MailboxACLRights in this MailboxACLRights. A schematic example: "lrw".except("w") returns "lr". Implementations must return a new unmodifiable instance of MailboxACL.MailboxACLRights. However, implementations may decide to return this or toRemove parameter value in case the result would be equal to the respective one of those.
        Parameters:
        toRemove -
        Returns:
        Throws:
        UnsupportedRightException

      • isEmpty

        boolean isEmpty()
        Tells if this set of rights is empty.
        Returns:
        true if there are no rights in this set; false otherwise.

      • isSupported

        boolean isSupported(MailboxACL.MailboxACLRight right)
        Tells whether the implementation supports the given right.
        Parameters:
        right -
        Returns:
        true if this supports the given right.

      • serialize

        String serialize()
        Returns a serialized form of this MailboxACL.MailboxACLRights as String.
        Returns:
        a String

      • union

        MailboxACL.MailboxACLRights union(MailboxACL.MailboxACLRights toAdd)
                                  throws UnsupportedRightException
        Performs the set theoretic operation of union of this MailboxACLRights and toAdd MailboxACLRights. A schematic example: "lr".union("rw") returns "lrw". Implementations must return a new unmodifiable instance of MailboxACL.MailboxACLRights. However, implementations may decide to return this or toAdd parameter value in case the result would be equal to the respective one of those.
        Parameters:
        toAdd -
        Returns:
        union of this and toAdd
        Throws:
        UnsupportedRightException
